item.title: SoftLayer_Network_Storage_Group_Type
item.description: SoftLayer_Network_Storage_Group_Type Service Datatype Description Methods getAllObjects Returns all storage group types available getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Network_Storage_Group_Type record.

item.title: SoftLayer_Network_Storage_Hub_Cleversafe_Account
item.description: SoftLayer_Network_Storage_Hub_Cleversafe_Account Service Datatype Description This class provides an interface for the management of IBM Cloud Object Storage Accounts and Credentials. Methods credentialCreate credentialDelete getAccount Retrieve softLayer account to which an IBM Cloud Object Storage account belongs to. getAllObjects getBillingItem Retrieve an associated parent billing item which is active. Includes billing items which are scheduled to be cancelled in the future.

item.title: SoftLayer_Network_Storage_Hub_Swift_Share
item.description: SoftLayer_Network_Storage_Hub_Swift_Share Service Datatype Description Methods getContainerList Get a list of the file containers for a brand. getFile Download a file. getFileList Get a list of the files in a container and path.

item.title: SoftLayer_Network_Storage_Iscsi
item.description: SoftLayer_Network_Storage_Iscsi Service Datatype Description SoftLayer’s iscsi product extends upon the base functionality of SoftLayer offerings by providing snapshot and replication capabilities. An iscsi volume is mounted through SoftLayer’s private network and allows for block level additional storage on a highly redundant disk array. SoftLayer’s iscsi offering is capable of taking volume snapshots which can be mounted read-only or used for an immediate volume data restore. This high-end Storage offering is also capable of being configured for remote data replication to any of SoftLayer’s datacenters to provide a solid disaster recovery solution.

item.title: SoftLayer_Network_Storage_Iscsi_OS_Type
item.description: SoftLayer_Network_Storage_Iscsi_OS_Type Service Datatype Description Methods getAllObjects Returns all iSCSI OS Types getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Network_Storage_Iscsi_OS_Type record.

item.title: SoftLayer_Network_Storage_MassDataMigration_CrossRegion_Country_Xref
item.description: SoftLayer_Network_Storage_MassDataMigration_CrossRegion_Country_Xref Service Datatype Description MassDataMigration_CrossRegion_Country_Xref provides a list of countries where Mass Data Migration Device could be shipped for each CleverSafe Object Storage Region. Methods getAllObjects getCountry Retrieve softLayer_Locale_Country Id. getLocationGroup Retrieve location Group ID of CleverSafe cross region. getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Network_Storage_MassDataMigration_CrossRegion_Country_Xref record.

item.title: SoftLayer_Network_Storage_MassDataMigration_Request
item.description: SoftLayer_Network_Storage_MassDataMigration_Request Service Datatype Description Mass Data Migration Request Service allows users to request Massive storage device to copy onsite data. Once user has copied their data onto device, they ship it back to SoftLayer where device is connected to network and data is transferred to Object Storage bucket. Currently, the initial usage period is two weeks . Additional time for maintaining the media for continued may be purchased.

item.title: SoftLayer_Network_Storage_MassDataMigration_Request_KeyContact
item.description: SoftLayer_Network_Storage_MassDataMigration_Request_KeyContact Service Datatype Description The SoftLayer_Network_Storage_MassDataMigration_Request_KeyContact data type contains name, email, and phone for key contact at customer location who will handle Mass Data Migration. Methods getAccount Retrieve the request this key contact belongs to. getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Network_Storage_MassDataMigration_Request_KeyContact record. getRequest Retrieve the request this key contact belongs to.

item.title: SoftLayer_Network_Storage_MassDataMigration_Request_Status
item.description: SoftLayer_Network_Storage_MassDataMigration_Request_Status Service Datatype Description Methods getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Network_Storage_MassDataMigration_Request_Status record.

item.title: SoftLayer_Network_Storage_Schedule
item.description: SoftLayer_Network_Storage_Schedule Service Datatype Description Schedules can be created for select Storage services, such as iscsi. These schedules are used to perform various tasks such as scheduling snapshots or synchronizing replicants. The schedule service can be used to create, edit, or delete a schedule. Schedules are defined by the properties associated with them to specify values such as the start date, interval, or end date of the schedule.

item.title: SoftLayer_Network_Storage_Schedule_Property_Type
item.description: SoftLayer_Network_Storage_Schedule_Property_Type Service Datatype Description Methods getAllObjects Returns all network storage schedule property types getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Network_Storage_Schedule_Property_Type record.

item.title: SoftLayer_Network_Subnet
item.description: SoftLayer_Network_Subnet Service Datatype Description Every SoftLayer ip address is associated with a subnet which is defined in the SoftLayer_Network_Subnet service. SoftLayer subnets define a group of ip addresses and are assigned to a SoftLayer_Network_Vlan. The SoftLayer_Network_Subnet service gives you information about your subnet such as your network address, broadcast address, the subnet gateway address, and the total number of IP addresses within the subnet. Use the data returned by these methods with other API services to get more detailed information about your services.

item.title: SoftLayer_Network_Subnet_IpAddress
item.description: SoftLayer_Network_Subnet_IpAddress Service Datatype Description Every SoftLayer IP address is defined in the SoftLayer_Network_Subnet_IpAddress service. SoftLayer IP addresses are assigned to a SoftLayer_Network_Subnet. The SoftLayer_Network_Subnet_IpAddress service gives you information about an IP address such if it is reserved, a network address, or a gateway. Use the data returned by these methods with other API services to get more detailed information about your services. SoftLayer customers can order and manage IP addresses through the customer portal.

item.title: SoftLayer_Network_Subnet_IpAddress_Global
item.description: SoftLayer_Network_Subnet_IpAddress_Global Service Datatype Description Global IP Addresses are static IP addresses that can be routed to any server within the SoftLayer network. Global IP Addresses are not restricted to routing within the same datacenter. Methods getAccount getActiveTransaction Retrieve the active transaction associated with this Global IP. getBillingItem Retrieve the billing item for this Global IP. getDestinationIpAddress getIpAddress getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Network_Subnet_IpAddress_Global record.

item.title: SoftLayer_Network_Subnet_Registration
item.description: SoftLayer_Network_Subnet_Registration Service Datatype Description Subnet registration objects are used to request and track registration of the subnet with the appropriate Regional Internet Registry (RIR). Subnet registration is executed automatically for RIRs that require registration upon assignment, but this registration can be modified at any time. Subnet Registration objects can be updated after they are created. This will result in the information being submitted to the RIR and the records on their end being refreshed.

item.title: SoftLayer_Network_Subnet_Registration_Details
item.description: SoftLayer_Network_Subnet_Registration_Details Service Datatype Description Methods createObject Create a new association between a [[SoftLayer_Network_Subnet_Registration]] object and a [[SoftLayer_Account_Regional_Registry_Detail]] object. deleteObject Remove an existing association between a [[SoftLayer_Network_Subnet_Registration]] object and a [[SoftLayer_Account_Regional_Registry_Detail]] object. getDetail Retrieve the related [[SoftLayer_Account_Regional_Registry_Detail|detail object]]. getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Network_Subnet_Registration_Details record. getRegistration Retrieve the related [[SoftLayer_Network_Subnet_Registration|registration object]].

item.title: SoftLayer_Network_Subnet_Registration_Status
item.description: SoftLayer_Network_Subnet_Registration_Status Service Datatype Description Methods getAllObjects getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Network_Subnet_Registration_Status record.

item.title: SoftLayer_Network_Subnet_Rwhois_Data
item.description: SoftLayer_Network_Subnet_Rwhois_Data Service Datatype Description Every SoftLayer customer account has a RWHOIS record tied to it. This RWHOIS record is used by SoftLayer’s Reverse Whois system as well as SoftLayer’s Automated SWIP system. This service allows you to update your stored RWHOIS record. Changing this record automatically updates the RWHOIS record in 24 hours, but does NOT update SWIP data. You will need to use the SWIP service to do that.

item.title: SoftLayer_Network_Subnet_Swip_Transaction
item.description: SoftLayer_Network_Subnet_Swip_Transaction Service Datatype Description SoftLayer’s Automated Swip System is a finite state machine; it works by locally tracking a transaction between SoftLayer and the relevant Regional Internet Registry (RIR), assigning responsibility of a subnet to a customer. Transactions are dictated by the RIR’s processing system, and the nature of the communication medium with each RIR, namely their REST API. Using this API, SoftLayer Customers are able to initiate, monitor, update, and remove Swip system transactions with ARIN and RIPE.

item.title: SoftLayer_Network_TippingPointReporting
item.description: SoftLayer_Network_TippingPointReporting Service Datatype Description This general purpose class is used to retrieve intrusion protection statistics from the tipping point hardware located on the softlayer network. Every customer has access to the global intrusion protection statistics, as well as the detailed statistics for that user’s account. No actions can be taken using this system, it is for statistical reporting purposes only. If an attacking IP is identified using this system, please use the firewall system to take any actions that are appropriate.

item.title: SoftLayer_Network_Tunnel_Module_Context
item.description: SoftLayer_Network_Tunnel_Module_Context Service Datatype Description A SoftLayer network tunnel allows customer to authenticate and encrypt all IP traffic between two locations. Manage the entire network tunnel using this service. The SoftLayer_Network_Tunnel_Module_Context allows customers to manage subnets on both ends of the network tunnel. Address translations can also be managed. SoftLayer also provides the ability to apply the network tunnel configurations on the SoftLayer network devices. Methods addCustomerSubnetToNetworkTunnel Associate a remote subnet to a network tunnel addPrivateSubnetToNetworkTunnel Associate a private subnet to a network tunnel.

item.title: SoftLayer_Network_Vlan
item.description: SoftLayer_Network_Vlan Service Datatype Description Virtual LANs are an integral part of SoftLayer’ s public and private networks. A VLAN is a networking concept in which network interfaces on different routers, switches, and servers act as if they’re on the same local network broadcast domain. This kind of network segmentation helps keep SoftLayer customers’ networks separate from each other and provides a convenient mechanism for routing new IP subnets to servers.

item.title: SoftLayer_Network_Vlan_Firewall
item.description: SoftLayer_Network_Vlan_Firewall Service Datatype Description The SoftLayer_Network_Vlan_Firewall service accesses general information relating to a single SoftLayer VLAN firewall. This is the object which ties the running rules to a specific downstream server. The current running rule set can be pulled from this service. Use the [[SoftLayer Network Firewall Template]] service to pull SoftLayer recommended rule set templates. Use the [[SoftLayer Network Firewall Update Request]] service to submit a firewall update request.

item.title: SoftLayer_Network_Vlan_Type
item.description: SoftLayer_Network_Vlan_Type Service Datatype Description A network VLAN type is a value representing the type of a network VLAN. The possible values are: STANDARD - A VLAN for normal server or guest use GATEWAY - A VLAN designated for use as a network gateway VLAN Methods getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Network_Vlan_Type record.

item.title: SoftLayer_Notification
item.description: SoftLayer_Notification Service Datatype Description SoftLayer Customers can use this service to view all of the available notifications that can be subscribed to. Some of the notifications are required while others are not. Methods getAllObjects Retrieve all Notifications that can be subscribed to. getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Notification record. getPreferences Retrieve the preferences related to the notification. These are preferences are configurable and optional for subscribers to use.

item.title: SoftLayer_Notification_Mobile
item.description: SoftLayer_Notification_Mobile Service Datatype Description SoftLayer Customers can use this service to view all of the available mobile notifications that can be subscribed to. No mobile notifications are required. Methods createSubscriberForMobileDevice Create a new subscriber for a given resource. getAllObjects Retrieve all Notifications that can be subscribed to. getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Notification_Mobile record. getPreferences Retrieve the preferences related to the notification.

item.title: SoftLayer_Notification_Occurrence_Event
item.description: SoftLayer_Notification_Occurrence_Event Service Datatype Description The [[SoftLayer_Notification_Occurrence_Event]] service represents all events with potential to cause a disruption in service. Methods acknowledgeNotification getAcknowledgedFlag Retrieve indicates whether or not this event has been acknowledged by the user. getAllObjects getAttachedFile Retrieve a file attached to an event. getAttachments Retrieve a collection of attachments for this event which provide supplementary information to impacted users some examples are RFO (Reason For Outage) and root cause analysis documents.

item.title: SoftLayer_Notification_Occurrence_User
item.description: SoftLayer_Notification_Occurrence_User Service Datatype Description Methods acknowledge Acknowledge the associated [[SoftLayer_Notification_Occurrence_Event]] for this impacted user. getAllObjects Returns a collection of impacted users, an account master user has the ability to see all impacted users under the account. getImpactedDeviceCount A count representing the number of the user's devices currently impacted by the associated event will be returned. getImpactedResources Retrieve a collection of resources impacted by the associated event.

item.title: SoftLayer_Notification_User_Subscriber
item.description: SoftLayer_Notification_User_Subscriber Service Datatype Description SoftLayer Customers can subscribe to receive notifications for various notification types. This service also allows you to “turn on” or “turn off” notification messages sent to a subscriber for certain notifications. Methods createObject Create a new notification subscriber. editObject Edit a notification subscriber active status getDeliveryMethods Retrieve the delivery methods used to send the subscribed notification.

item.title: SoftLayer_Notification_User_Subscriber_Billing
item.description: SoftLayer_Notification_User_Subscriber_Billing Service Datatype Description SoftLayer Customers can subscribe to receive notifications for various notification types. This service also allows you to “turn on” or “turn off” notification messages sent to a subscriber for certain notifications. Methods createObject Create a new notification subscriber. editObject Edit a notification subscriber active status getDeliveryMethods Retrieve the delivery methods used to send the subscribed notification.

item.title: SoftLayer_Notification_User_Subscriber_Mobile
item.description: SoftLayer_Notification_User_Subscriber_Mobile Service Datatype Description SoftLayer Customers can subscribe to receive notifications for various notification types. This service also allows you to “turn on” or “turn off” notification messages sent to a subscriber for certain notifications. Methods clearSnoozeTimer createObject Create a new notification subscriber. editObject Edit a notification subscriber active status getDeliveryMethods Retrieve the delivery methods used to send the subscribed notification.

item.title: SoftLayer_Notification_User_Subscriber_Preference
item.description: SoftLayer_Notification_User_Subscriber_Preference Service Datatype Description Methods createObject Create a new notification preference for a subscriber. editObjects getDefaultPreference Retrieve details such name, keyname, minimum and maximum values for the preference. getNotificationUserSubscriber Retrieve details of the subscriber tied to the preference. getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Notification_User_Subscriber_Preference record.

item.title: SoftLayer_Product_Item_Category
item.description: SoftLayer_Product_Item_Category Service Datatype Description Retrieve the category information for a product item. Methods getAdditionalProductsForCategory Return a list of Items in the "Additional Services" package with their active prices for a given product item category. getBandwidthCategories getBillingItems Retrieve the billing items associated with an account that share a category code with an item category's category code. getComputingCategories Returns a collection of computing categories.

item.title: SoftLayer_Product_Item_Category_Group
item.description: SoftLayer_Product_Item_Category_Group Service Datatype Description Retrieve the category group information for a product item. Methods getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Product_Item_Category_Group record.

item.title: SoftLayer_Product_Item_Policy_Assignment
item.description: SoftLayer_Product_Item_Policy_Assignment Service Datatype Description Serves as a data source for additional information about the policy to product assignment. Methods acceptFromTicket Register acceptance of this assignment linking this record to a Ticket. getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Product_Item_Policy_Assignment record. getPolicyDocumentContents Retrieve the binary content of the policy document. getPolicyName Retrieve the name of the assigned policy. getProduct Retrieve the [[SoftLayer_Product_Item]] for this policy assignment.

item.title: SoftLayer_Product_Item_Price
item.description: SoftLayer_Product_Item_Price Service Datatype Description The SoftLayer_Product_Item_Price contains general information relating to a single SoftLayer product item price. You can find out what packages each price is in as well as which category under which this price is sold. All prices are returned in floating point values measured in US Dollars ($USD). Methods getAccountRestrictions Retrieve the account that the item price is restricted to. getAttributes getBigDataOsJournalDiskFlag Retrieve whether the price is for Big Data OS/Journal disks only.

item.title: SoftLayer_Product_Item_Price_Premium
item.description: SoftLayer_Product_Item_Price_Premium Service Datatype Description Methods getItemPrice getLocation getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Product_Item_Price_Premium record. getPackage

item.title: SoftLayer_Product_Order
item.description: SoftLayer_Product_Order Service Datatype Description All orders (servers, virtual servers and services) pass through the [[SoftLayer_Product_Order]] service. This service provides the entry point for placing orders and quotes with SoftLayer. To place orders using these services, you must provide the appropriate container type as defined by [[SoftLayer_Container_Product_Order]]. For server orders, you would use [[SoftLayer_Container_Product_Order_Hardware_Server]]. For virtual server orders, you would use [[SoftLayer_Container_Product_Order_Virtual_Guest]]. For additional service orders, it will depend on the additional service (e.

item.title: SoftLayer_Product_Package
item.description: SoftLayer_Product_Package Service Datatype Description Every SoftLayer_Product_Package contains information related products and services that SoftLayer sells. The configuration of this package reveals which categories are required to place an order for this package. Every package has items, item prices, locations, regions, and a configuration. This service is the starting point for ordering servers, and other services we provide. Methods getAccountRestrictedActivePresets Retrieve the preset configurations available only for the authenticated account and this package.

item.title: SoftLayer_Product_Package_Preset
item.description: SoftLayer_Product_Package_Preset Service Datatype Description Methods getAllObjects Get all active package presets getAvailableStorageUnits getCategories Retrieve the item categories that are included in this package preset configuration. getComputeGroup Retrieve the compute family this configuration belongs to. getConfiguration Retrieve the preset configuration (category and price). getDisallowedComputeGroupUpgradeFlag Retrieve when true this preset is only allowed to upgrade/downgrade to other presets in the same compute family.

item.title: SoftLayer_Product_Package_Server
item.description: SoftLayer_Product_Package_Server Service Datatype Description Methods getAllObjects Get the package servers getCatalog getItem getItemPrice getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Product_Package_Server record. getPackage getPreset

item.title: SoftLayer_Product_Package_Server_Option
item.description: SoftLayer_Product_Package_Server_Option Service Datatype Description Methods getAllOptions Get all the package server options getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Product_Package_Server_Option record. getOptions Get all the package server options of a particular type

item.title: SoftLayer_Product_Package_Type
item.description: SoftLayer_Product_Package_Type Service Datatype Description The [[SoftLayer_Product_Package_Type]] object indicates the type for a service offering (package). The type can be used to filter packages. To find all the available types, call getAllObjects on this class. Methods getAllObjects Get all the package types. getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Product_Package_Type record. getPackages Retrieve all the packages associated with the given package type.

item.title: SoftLayer_Product_Upgrade_Request
item.description: SoftLayer_Product_Upgrade_Request Service Datatype Description SoftLayer_Product_Upgrade_Request tracks the progress of an upgrade, and allows modification of the maintenance window and other information. Methods approveChanges Approves the upgrade request order that was revised by SoftLayer Sales getAccount Retrieve the account that an order belongs to getCompletedFlag Retrieve indicates that the upgrade request has completed or has been cancelled. getInvoice Retrieve this is the invoice associated with the upgrade request.

item.title: SoftLayer_Provisioning_Hook
item.description: SoftLayer_Provisioning_Hook Service Datatype Description Methods createObject deleteObject editObject getAccount getHookType getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Provisioning_Hook record.

item.title: SoftLayer_Provisioning_Hook_Type
item.description: SoftLayer_Provisioning_Hook_Type Service Datatype Description Methods getAllHookTypes getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Provisioning_Hook_Type record.

item.title: SoftLayer_Provisioning_Maintenance_Classification
item.description: SoftLayer_Provisioning_Maintenance_Classification Service Datatype Description The SoftLayer_Provisioning_Maintenance_Classification service returns available maintenance classifications. Methods getItemCategories getMaintenanceClassification Retrieve a maintenance classification. getMaintenanceClassificationsByItemCategory Retrieve all maintenance classifications. getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Provisioning_Maintenance_Classification record.

item.title: SoftLayer_Provisioning_Maintenance_Classification_Item_Category
item.description: SoftLayer_Provisioning_Maintenance_Classification_Item_Category Service Datatype Description Methods getMaintenanceClassification getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Provisioning_Maintenance_Classification_Item_Category record.

item.title: SoftLayer_Provisioning_Maintenance_Slots
item.description: SoftLayer_Provisioning_Maintenance_Slots Service Datatype Description The SoftLayer_Provisioning_Maintenance_Slots service returns available maintenance slots at SoftLayer data centers. Methods getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Provisioning_Maintenance_Slots record.

item.title: SoftLayer_Provisioning_Maintenance_Ticket
item.description: SoftLayer_Provisioning_Maintenance_Ticket Service Datatype Description Methods getAvailableSlots getMaintenanceClass getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Provisioning_Maintenance_Ticket record. getTicket

item.title: SoftLayer_Provisioning_Maintenance_Window
item.description: SoftLayer_Provisioning_Maintenance_Window Service Datatype Description The SoftLayer_Provisioning_Maintenance_Window service returns available maintenance windows at SoftLayer data centers. Methods addCustomerUpgradeWindow Updates or creates records in the getMaintenanceClassifications Returns the maintenance classifications getMaintenanceStartEndTime Returns a specific maintenance window getMaintenanceWindowForTicket Returns a specific maintenance window getMaintenanceWindowTicketsByTicketId Returns maintenance window ticket getMaintenanceWindows Returns available maintenance windows getMaintenceWindows Returns available maintenance windows updateCustomerUpgradeWindow Creates records in the appropriate

item.title: SoftLayer_Provisioning_Version1_Transaction_Group
item.description: SoftLayer_Provisioning_Version1_Transaction_Group Service Datatype Description The service lists the different types of transactions. This includes operating system reloads and new operating system provisions. Methods getAllObjects getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Provisioning_Version1_Transaction_Group record.

item.title: SoftLayer_Resource_Configuration
item.description: SoftLayer_Resource_Configuration Service Datatype Description The Resource Configuration service enables the user to update data regarding a resource from which the request originates. It is a requirement that the request must have an authentication token as well as originate from the backend network of the resource. Methods setOsPasswordFromEncrypted Set resource operating system password from an encrypted password

item.title: SoftLayer_Resource_Group
item.description: SoftLayer_Resource_Group Service Datatype Description SoftLayer’s resource group service allows users to access a broad overview of the resource group and its members Methods editObject getAncestorGroups Retrieve a resource group's associated group ancestors. getAttributes Retrieve a resource group's associated attributes. getHardwareMembers Retrieve a resource group's associated hardware members. getMembers Retrieve a resource group's associated members. getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Resource_Group record.

item.title: SoftLayer_Resource_Group_Template
item.description: SoftLayer_Resource_Group_Template Service Datatype Description Methods getAllObjects getChildren getMembers getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Resource_Group_Template record. getPackage

item.title: SoftLayer_Resource_Metadata
item.description: SoftLayer_Resource_Metadata Service Datatype Description The Resource Metadata service enables the user to obtain information regarding the resource from which the request originates. Due to the requirement that the request originate from the backend network of the resource, no API key is necessary to perform the request. The primary use of this service is to allow self-discovery for newly provisioned resources, enabling further automated setup by the user.

item.title: SoftLayer_Sales_Presale_Event
item.description: SoftLayer_Sales_Presale_Event Service Datatype Description Presale events are related to datacenters or products that are not yet currently available, but will be in the near future. For example, if a new datacenter is opening in a month, a presale event may be created that allows customers to purchase server space in advance. When a presale order is placed, the server configuration is saved, but not provisioned until the presale end date - the server will not be available during this waiting period.

item.title: SoftLayer_Scale_Asset
item.description: SoftLayer_Scale_Asset Service Datatype Description The base asset of a scale group. Assets are fixed, non-volatile units of a scale group. They are pinned to the group and will not be automatically added or removed. Their primary purpose is to provide information for the policies to use to determine when to scale members. Methods deleteObject Delete this group asset. getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Scale_Asset record.

item.title: SoftLayer_Scale_Asset_Hardware
item.description: SoftLayer_Scale_Asset_Hardware Service Datatype Description A hardware asset is a fixed asset of scale group. It is not automatically scaled up or down in any way. Its purpose is to provide information (e.g. metrics) to policies to affect scaling decisions. Currently hardware assets are unsupported. Methods createObject Pin hardware on a group. This can be done at anytime, whether the group is active or not.

item.title: SoftLayer_Scale_Asset_Virtual_Guest
item.description: SoftLayer_Scale_Asset_Virtual_Guest Service Datatype Description A guest asset is a fixed asset of scale group. It is not automatically scaled up or down in any way. Its purpose is to provide information (e.g. metrics) to policies to affect scaling decisions. Methods createObject Pin a guest on a group. This can be done at anytime, whether the group is active or not. deleteObject Delete this group asset.

item.title: SoftLayer_Scale_Group
item.description: SoftLayer_Scale_Group Service Datatype Description A scale group can contain a number of guest members which can fluctuate up and down, staying within a defined range, manually or automatically based on policies given. Groups are set of VLANs to be placed behind. Groups can also have static hardware/guests pinned to the group. These static resources can be used to effect things like moving averages for policy triggers but are not counted as group members and are not subject to automatic reclaim.

item.title: SoftLayer_Scale_Group_Status
item.description: SoftLayer_Scale_Group_Status Service Datatype Description The status of a scale group. This status affects what actions can occur on a group. The values can be: ACTIVE - There are no actions execution for any members or assets of any type. BUSY - There is an action executing for one of the members or assets, but that action is not a scaling action. SCALING - At least one of the members is in the process of being created or destroyed.

item.title: SoftLayer_Scale_LoadBalancer
item.description: SoftLayer_Scale_LoadBalancer Service Datatype Description A scale load balancer is a configuration for a load balancer virtual server that autoscaled members will be automatically configured for. Methods createObject Create a load balancer for a scale group. deleteObject Delete this load balancer configuration. editObject Edit this load balancer configuration. getAllocationPercent Retrieve the percentage of connections allocated to this virtual server.

item.title: SoftLayer_Scale_Member
item.description: SoftLayer_Scale_Member Service Datatype Description The base member of a scale group. Members are the volatile scaling units of a scale group. This cannot be used by itself, one of the more specific member types and services must be used. Methods deleteObject Delete this group member. This is not the recommended way to delete members. Instead, users should use invocations on the group itself to do scaling.

item.title: SoftLayer_Scale_Member_Virtual_Guest
item.description: SoftLayer_Scale_Member_Virtual_Guest Service Datatype Description A guest member is a scaled guest on a scale group. It is added either automatically or manually based on group settings. It can be removed here, but is usually best removed using one of the scaling features of the group as a whole. Methods deleteObject Delete this group member. getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Scale_Member_Virtual_Guest record. getScaleGroup Retrieve the group this member belongs to.

item.title: SoftLayer_Scale_Network_Vlan
item.description: SoftLayer_Scale_Network_Vlan Service Datatype Description A scale network VLAN is a VLAN that scaled members will be placed on. Methods createObject Create a network VLAN for a scale group. Once created, the VLAN will be used to scale with. deleteObject Delete this network VLAN reference. Note, this does not affect existing scaled members. Once deleted however, future scaled members will not be placed on this referenced VLAN.

item.title: SoftLayer_Scale_Policy
item.description: SoftLayer_Scale_Policy Service Datatype Description A scale policy is a combination of triggers and actions that can occur on a scale group. When any trigger is satisfied (or the policy is manually triggered) the actions will be executed. Methods createObject Add a policy to a group. deleteObject Delete this policy from the group. editObject Edit this policy's name. getActions Retrieve the actions to perform upon any trigger hit.

item.title: SoftLayer_Scale_Policy_Action
item.description: SoftLayer_Scale_Policy_Action Service Datatype Description An action to execute when a policy is triggered. Currently only one action can be associated with a policy and it must be created with the policy. Methods deleteObject Delete this action. editObject Edit this action. getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Scale_Policy_Action record. getScalePolicy Retrieve the policy this action is on. getType Retrieve the type of action.

item.title: SoftLayer_Scale_Policy_Action_Scale
item.description: SoftLayer_Scale_Policy_Action_Scale Service Datatype Description A policy action to scale a group. A group can be scaled to an absolute member number or by a relative amount using a fixed number or a percentage. Methods createObject Create a one-time policy trigger. deleteObject Delete this action. editObject Edit this action. getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Scale_Policy_Action_Scale record. getScalePolicy Retrieve the policy this action is on.

item.title: SoftLayer_Scale_Policy_Action_Type
item.description: SoftLayer_Scale_Policy_Action_Type Service Datatype Description An action type Methods getAllObjects Get all action types getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Scale_Policy_Action_Type record.

item.title: SoftLayer_Scale_Policy_Trigger
item.description: SoftLayer_Scale_Policy_Trigger Service Datatype Description A trigger to determine when a policy’s actions should be fired. Methods createObject Create a policy trigger. deleteObject Delete this trigger. editObject Edit this trigger. getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Scale_Policy_Trigger record. getScalePolicy Retrieve the policy this trigger is on. getType Retrieve the type of trigger.

item.title: SoftLayer_Scale_Policy_Trigger_OneTime
item.description: SoftLayer_Scale_Policy_Trigger_OneTime Service Datatype Description A trigger that will only execute once on the given date. If the auto scale group is suspended this will not occur. Methods createObject Create a one-time policy trigger. deleteObject Delete this trigger. editObject Edit this trigger. getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Scale_Policy_Trigger_OneTime record. getScalePolicy Retrieve the policy this trigger is on. getType Retrieve the type of trigger.

item.title: SoftLayer_Scale_Policy_Trigger_Repeating
item.description: SoftLayer_Scale_Policy_Trigger_Repeating Service Datatype Description A trigger that will execute every so often. Methods createObject Create a repeating policy trigger. deleteObject Delete this trigger. editObject Edit this trigger. getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Scale_Policy_Trigger_Repeating record. getScalePolicy Retrieve the policy this trigger is on. getType Retrieve the type of trigger. validateCronExpression Validate a CRON expression.

item.title: SoftLayer_Scale_Policy_Trigger_ResourceUse
item.description: SoftLayer_Scale_Policy_Trigger_ResourceUse Service Datatype Description A trigger that will only execute only when all guests on the group (both static and member) satisfy certain resource watches. Methods createObject Create a resource-use policy trigger. deleteObject Delete this trigger. editObject Edit this trigger. getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Scale_Policy_Trigger_ResourceUse record. getScalePolicy Retrieve the policy this trigger is on. getType Retrieve the type of trigger.

item.title: SoftLayer_Scale_Policy_Trigger_ResourceUse_Watch
item.description: SoftLayer_Scale_Policy_Trigger_ResourceUse_Watch Service Datatype Description This is a specific watch for a resource use policy trigger. Methods createObject Create a watch on an existing resource trigger. deleteObject Delete this watch from the trigger. You cannot delete the last watch on a trigger. editObject Edit this watch. getAllPossibleAlgorithms Get all possible values for "algorithm". getAllPossibleMetrics Get all possible values for "

item.title: SoftLayer_Scale_Policy_Trigger_Type
item.description: SoftLayer_Scale_Policy_Trigger_Type Service Datatype Description A trigger type Methods getAllObjects Get all trigger types getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Scale_Policy_Trigger_Type record.

item.title: SoftLayer_Scale_Termination_Policy
item.description: SoftLayer_Scale_Termination_Policy Service Datatype Description A policy for automatic removal of members from a group. This policy determines which members are chosen first for removal. The values can be: OLDEST - The oldest member is the next one removed. NEWEST - The newest member is the next one removed. CLOSEST_TO_NEXT_CHARGE - The member closest to the next charge is removed. This is helpful for billing because it will let you remove the member you have gotten the most out of.

item.title: SoftLayer_Search
item.description: SoftLayer_Search Service Datatype Description SoftLayer’s account historical service allows users to access a broad overview of devices for that account and historical details concerning the overall function and performance of the devices on that account Methods advancedSearch Search for SoftLayer Resources by simple terms. getObjectTypes Return a collection of indexed object types. search Search for SoftLayer Resources by simple phrase.

item.title: SoftLayer_Security_Certificate
item.description: SoftLayer_Security_Certificate Service Datatype Description Methods createObject deleteObject editObject findByCommonName getAssociatedServiceCount Retrieve the number of services currently associated with the certificate. getLoadBalancerVirtualIpAddresses Retrieve the load balancers virtual IP addresses currently associated with the certificate. getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Security_Certificate record. getPemFormat

item.title: SoftLayer_Security_Certificate_Request
item.description: SoftLayer_Security_Certificate_Request Service Datatype Description SoftLayer_Security_Certificate_Request holds your SSL certificate request data. This data is used to place an SSL certificate order with a Certificate Authority. To create an SSL certificate order, pass a completed [[SoftLayer_Container_Product_Order_Security_Certificate|SSL order container]] to the [[SoftLayer_Product_Order::placeOrder|SoftLayer ordering service]]. Methods cancelSslOrder Cancels a pending SSL certificate order at the Certificate Authority getAccount Retrieve the account to which a SSL certificate request belongs.

item.title: SoftLayer_Security_Certificate_Request_ServerType
item.description: SoftLayer_Security_Certificate_Request_ServerType Service Datatype Description Allows for retrieving the available SSL certificate server types. Methods getAllObjects Returns all SSL certificate server types getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Security_Certificate_Request_ServerType record.

item.title: SoftLayer_Security_Certificate_Request_Status
item.description: SoftLayer_Security_Certificate_Request_Status Service Datatype Description SoftLayer_Security_Certificate_Request_Status indicates the status of your SSL certificate request. When you submit an SSL certificate order, the associated certificate request will be in the “Pending CA Approval” status. This is the only status in which can cancel your order. Once the certificate authority (CA) approves your order, the status will change to “Approved”. Once your order is approved, you will receive your fulfillment email from the CA.

item.title: SoftLayer_Security_Ssh_Key
item.description: SoftLayer_Security_Ssh_Key Service Datatype Description Methods createObject deleteObject editObject getAccount getBlockDeviceTemplateGroups Retrieve the image template groups that are linked to an SSH key. getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Security_Ssh_Key record. getSoftwarePasswords Retrieve the OS root users that are linked to an SSH key.

item.title: SoftLayer_Software_AccountLicense
item.description: SoftLayer_Software_AccountLicense Service Datatype Description SoftLayer_Software_AccountLicense is the application class that handles a special type of Software License. Most software licenses are licensed to a specific hardware ID or IP address, this is tied to an account. seeAlso SoftLayer_Account SoftLayer_Software_Description Methods getAccount Retrieve the customer account this Account License belongs to. getAllObjects Return all account licenses getBillingItem Retrieve the billing item for a software account license.

item.title: SoftLayer_Software_Component
item.description: SoftLayer_Software_Component Service Datatype Description Every installed piece of software is represented in the API as a “Software Component.” This is the base class for software components, exposing basic functionality for software components. From any Software Component, through this service, you can get the hardware a component is installed upon, the license that this component is governed by, the current access passwords for a component, and the history of previous passwords for a component.

item.title: SoftLayer_Software_Component_AntivirusSpyware
item.description: SoftLayer_Software_Component_AntivirusSpyware Service Datatype Description This object specifies a specific type of Software Component: An Anti-virus/spyware instance. Methods getAverageInstallationDuration Retrieve the average amount of time that a software component takes to install. getBillingItem Retrieve the billing item for a software component. getHardware Retrieve the hardware this Software Component is installed upon. getLicenseFile Get the license file for a software component if it is supported.

item.title: SoftLayer_Software_Component_HostIps
item.description: SoftLayer_Software_Component_HostIps Service Datatype Description This service specifies a specific type of Software Component: A Host Intrusion Protection System instance. Methods getAverageInstallationDuration Retrieve the average amount of time that a software component takes to install. getBillingItem Retrieve the billing item for a software component. getCurrentHostIpsPolicies Get the current Host IPS policies. getHardware Retrieve the hardware this Software Component is installed upon.

item.title: SoftLayer_Software_Component_Password
item.description: SoftLayer_Software_Component_Password Service Datatype Description The software component password service represents the passwords for a software component, such as an operating system or a control panel. Updating the passwords here will NOT update them on the server itself. Methods createObject Create a password for a software component. createObjects Create more than one password for a software component. deleteObject Delete a password from a software component.

item.title: SoftLayer_Software_Description
item.description: SoftLayer_Software_Description Service Datatype Description Methods getAllObjects getAttributes getAverageInstallationDuration Retrieve the average amount of time that a software description takes to install. getCompatibleSoftwareDescriptions Retrieve a list of the software descriptions that are compatible with this software description. getCustomerOwnedLicenseDescriptions getFeatures Retrieve the feature attributes of a software description. getLatestVersion Retrieve the latest version of a software description.

item.title: SoftLayer_Software_VirtualLicense
item.description: SoftLayer_Software_VirtualLicense Service Datatype Description SoftLayer_Software_VirtualLicense is the application class that handles a special type of Software License. Most software licenses are licensed to a specific hardware ID; virtual licenses are designed for virtual machines and therefore are assigned to an IP Address. Not all software packages can be “virtual licensed”. SoftLayer_Software_VirtualLicense’s service allows you to retrieve the hard-copy license file for a virtual license, if one exists for your license instance.

item.title: SoftLayer_Survey
item.description: SoftLayer_Survey Service Datatype Description Every SoftLayer survey is defined in the SoftLayer_Survey service. Softlayer survey’s have questions and answers from SoftLayer users. Methods getActiveSurveyByType Provides survey details for the given type getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Survey record. getQuestions Retrieve the questions for a survey. getStatus Retrieve the status of the survey getType Retrieve the type of survey takeSurvey Respond to the questions that a survey has.

item.title: SoftLayer_Tag
item.description: SoftLayer_Tag Service Datatype Description SoftLayer’s tagging service gives customers the ability to tag devices with keywords that can later be used to search upon. Methods autoComplete Autocomplete tag inputted by a user getAccount Retrieve the account to which the tag is tied. getAllTagTypes get all valid tag types getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Tag record. getReferences Retrieve references that tie object to the tag.

item.title: SoftLayer_Ticket
item.description: SoftLayer_Ticket Service Datatype Description Tickets are SoftLayer’s primary way to keep in touch with its customers. A ticket is an entity that describes a problem or request and tracks a conversation between you, your account users, and SoftLayer employees relating to your problem or request. Tickets can be assigned to one of your account users, and SoftLayer can assign a ticket to a particular department (also called a ticket group) or employee.

item.title: SoftLayer_Ticket_Attachment_File
item.description: SoftLayer_Ticket_Attachment_File Service Datatype Description Methods getExtensionWhitelist getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Ticket_Attachment_File record. getTicket getUpdate Retrieve the ticket that a file is attached to.

item.title: SoftLayer_Ticket_Priority
item.description: SoftLayer_Ticket_Priority Service Datatype Description Methods getPriorities Obtain a container of valid ticket priority values with value/name key pairs.

item.title: SoftLayer_Ticket_Subject
item.description: SoftLayer_Ticket_Subject Service Datatype Description Every standard support ticket submitted to SoftLayer contains a relationship to a pre-determined subject which populates that ticket’s title. The SoftLayer_Ticket_Subject service retrieves these subjects. These ticket subjects also determine which department a ticket is opened for. seeAlso SoftLayer_Ticket SoftLayer_Ticket_Subject (type) Methods getAllObjects Retrieve all ticket subjects. getCategory getChildren Retrieve a child subject getGroup getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Ticket_Subject record.

item.title: SoftLayer_Ticket_Subject_Category
item.description: SoftLayer_Ticket_Subject_Category Service Datatype Description Methods getAllObjects Retrieve all ticket subject categories. getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Ticket_Subject_Category record. getSubjects

item.title: SoftLayer_Ticket_Survey
item.description: SoftLayer_Ticket_Survey Service Datatype Description Methods getPreference Returns ticket survey preferences optIn *DEPRICATED* Opt in for the ticket survey optOut *DEPRICATED* Opt out of the customer satisfaction survey for the next 90 days

item.title: SoftLayer_Ticket_Update_Employee
item.description: SoftLayer_Ticket_Update_Employee Service Datatype Description Retrieve an update to a ticket made by a SoftLayer employee. Ticket updates created by employees have the option of being rated on a one to five scale. Because customer updates don’t have this ability the SoftLayer_Ticket_Update_Employee class has it’s own service. seeAlso SoftLayer_Ticket SoftLayer_Ticket_Update Methods addResponseRating Set an update's response rating. getChangeOwnerActivity getEditor Retrieve a representation of the SoftLayer employee who created a ticket update.

item.title: SoftLayer_User_Customer
item.description: SoftLayer_User_Customer Service Datatype Description Every SoftLayer account has one or more portal users which are defined by the SoftLayer_User_Customer service. Every SoftLayer customer account has a master user account whose name corresponds to their account id preceded by the letters “SL”. Users exist in a parent-child relationship. Child users inherit the properties and permissions of their parent user while conversely a user may have more than one child users.

item.title: SoftLayer_User_Customer_ApiAuthentication
item.description: SoftLayer_User_Customer_ApiAuthentication Service Datatype Description An account’s user may obtain access to SoftLayer’s API through this authentication service. Methods editObject getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_User_Customer_ApiAuthentication record. getUser Retrieve the user who owns the api authentication key.

item.title: SoftLayer_User_Customer_CustomerPermission_Permission
item.description: SoftLayer_User_Customer_CustomerPermission_Permission Service Datatype Description Portal account users who are not the master user (account owner) have permissions to allow them access to portal functionalities. Methods getAllObjects Retrieve all available permissions. getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_User_Customer_CustomerPermission_Permission record.

item.title: SoftLayer_User_Customer_External_Binding
item.description: SoftLayer_User_Customer_External_Binding Service Datatype Description <<< Methods deleteObject Delete an external authentication binding. disable Disable an external binding. enable Enable an external binding. getAttributes Retrieve attributes of an external authentication binding. getBillingItem Retrieve information regarding the billing item for external authentication. getNote Retrieve an optional note for identifying the external binding. getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_User_Customer_External_Binding record.

item.title: SoftLayer_User_Customer_External_Binding_Phone
item.description: SoftLayer_User_Customer_External_Binding_Phone Service Datatype Description SoftLayer provides its customers the ability to add an additional layer of security to the SoftLayer customer portal by requiring that a user login and authenticate with a trusted 3rd party before they are given access to their SoftLayer account. This is accomplished by creating an external binding for a specific vendor such as PhoneFactor. When the SoftLayer user attempts to log in to the SoftLayer customer portal or VPN, they will first be prompted for their normal SoftLayer username and password.

item.title: SoftLayer_User_Customer_External_Binding_Totp
item.description: SoftLayer_User_Customer_External_Binding_Totp Service Datatype Description SoftLayer provides its customers the ability to add an additional layer of security to the SoftLayer customer portal by requiring that a user login and authenticate with a trusted 3rd party before they are given access to their SoftLayer account. This is accomplished by creating an external binding for a specific vendor, in this case Time-based One Time Password. When the SoftLayer user attempts to log in to the SoftLayer customer portal they will first be prompted for their normal SoftLayer username and password.

item.title: SoftLayer_User_Customer_External_Binding_Vendor
item.description: SoftLayer_User_Customer_External_Binding_Vendor Service Datatype Description The SoftLayer_User_Customer_External_Binding_Vendor service is used to retrieve a list of available 3rd party vendors that SoftLayer supports for external bindings. Methods getAllObjects Get a list of all available external binding vendors that SoftLayer supports. getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_User_Customer_External_Binding_Vendor record.

item.title: SoftLayer_User_Customer_External_Binding_Verisign
item.description: SoftLayer_User_Customer_External_Binding_Verisign Service Datatype Description SoftLayer provides its customers the ability to add an additional layer of security to the SoftLayer customer portal by requiring that a user login and authenticate with a trusted 3rd party before they are given access to their SoftLayer account. This is accomplished by creating an external binding for a specific vendor, in this case VeriSign. When the SoftLayer user attempts to log in to the SoftLayer customer portal they will first be prompted for their normal SoftLayer username and password.

item.title: SoftLayer_User_Customer_Invitation
item.description: SoftLayer_User_Customer_Invitation Service Datatype Description Methods getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_User_Customer_Invitation record. getUser

item.title: SoftLayer_User_Customer_MobileDevice
item.description: SoftLayer_User_Customer_MobileDevice Service Datatype Description Methods createObject Create a new mobile device association for a user. deleteObject Delete a mobile device association for a user. editObject Edit the object by passing in a modified instance of the object. getAvailablePushNotificationSubscriptions Retrieve notification subscriptions available to a mobile device. getCustomer Retrieve the user this mobile device belongs to. getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_User_Customer_MobileDevice record.

item.title: SoftLayer_User_Customer_MobileDevice_OperatingSystem
item.description: SoftLayer_User_Customer_MobileDevice_OperatingSystem Service Datatype Description Methods getAllObjects getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_User_Customer_MobileDevice_OperatingSystem record.

item.title: SoftLayer_User_Customer_MobileDevice_Type
item.description: SoftLayer_User_Customer_MobileDevice_Type Service Datatype Description Methods getAllObjects getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_User_Customer_MobileDevice_Type record.

item.title: SoftLayer_User_Customer_Notification_Hardware
item.description: SoftLayer_User_Customer_Notification_Hardware Service Datatype Description This service represents the link between a monitored hardware instance, and a user account. When a monitoring service on that hardware instance fails and the monitor is set to “notify users,” any users linked to that hardware instance using this service will be notified of the failure. Methods createObject Create a user hardware notification entry createObjects Create multiple user hardware notification entries at once deleteObjects Delete a group of Customer_Notification_Hardware objects by passing in a collection of them findByHardwareId Return all hardware notifications associated with the passed hardware ID getHardware Retrieve the hardware object that will be monitored.

item.title: SoftLayer_User_Customer_Notification_Virtual_Guest
item.description: SoftLayer_User_Customer_Notification_Virtual_Guest Service Datatype Description This service represents the link between a monitored guest instance, and a user account. When a monitoring service on that guest instance fails and the monitor is set to “notify users,” any users linked to that guest instance using this service will be notified of the failure. Methods createObject Create a user virtual guest notification entry createObjects Create multiple user hardware notification entries at once deleteObjects Delete a group of SoftLayer_Customer_Notification_Virtual_Guest objects by passing in a collection of them findByGuestId Return all CloudLayer computing instance notifications associated with the passed ID getGuest Retrieve the virtual guest object that will be monitored.

item.title: SoftLayer_User_Customer_OpenIdConnect
item.description: SoftLayer_User_Customer_OpenIdConnect Service Datatype Description Methods acknowledgeSupportPolicy activateOpenIdConnectUser Completes invitation process for an OIDC user initiated by the addApiAuthenticationKey Create a user's API authentication key. addBulkDedicatedHostAccess Grant access to the user for one or more dedicated hosts devices. addBulkHardwareAccess Add multiple hardware to a portal user's hardware access list. addBulkPortalPermission Add multiple permissions to a portal user's permission set.

item.title: SoftLayer_User_Customer_Prospect_ServiceProvider_EnrollRequest
item.description: SoftLayer_User_Customer_Prospect_ServiceProvider_EnrollRequest Service Datatype Description Methods enroll Creates a new Service Provider Enrollment getCompanyType Retrieve catalyst company types. getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_User_Customer_Prospect_ServiceProvider_EnrollRequest record.

item.title: SoftLayer_User_Customer_Security_Answer
item.description: SoftLayer_User_Customer_Security_Answer Service Datatype Description An account’s user have security answers for secondary security measures. These questions/answers can be found during login and password update. These questions/answers are also needed for password reset. Methods getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_User_Customer_Security_Answer record. getQuestion Retrieve the question the security answer is associated with. getUser Retrieve the user who the security answer belongs to.

item.title: SoftLayer_User_Customer_Status
item.description: SoftLayer_User_Customer_Status Service Datatype Description A User’s status. It can be Active, Inactive, Disabled, Delete User, or VPN Only. Methods getAllObjects Retrieve all user status objects. getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_User_Customer_Status record.

item.title: SoftLayer_User_External_Binding
item.description: SoftLayer_User_External_Binding Service Datatype Description <<< Methods deleteObject Delete an external authentication binding. getAttributes Retrieve attributes of an external authentication binding. getBillingItem Retrieve information regarding the billing item for external authentication. getNote Retrieve an optional note for identifying the external binding. getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_User_External_Binding record. getType Retrieve the type of external authentication binding. getVendor Retrieve the vendor of an external authentication binding.

item.title: SoftLayer_User_External_Binding_Vendor
item.description: SoftLayer_User_External_Binding_Vendor Service Datatype Description The SoftLayer_User_External_Binding_Vendor service is used to retrieve a list of available 3rd party vendors that SoftLayer supports for external bindings. Methods getAllObjects Get a list of all available external binding vendors that SoftLayer supports. getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_User_External_Binding_Vendor record.

item.title: SoftLayer_User_Permission_Action
item.description: SoftLayer_User_Permission_Action Service Datatype Description Methods getAllObjects getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_User_Permission_Action record.

item.title: SoftLayer_User_Permission_Group
item.description: SoftLayer_User_Permission_Group Service Datatype Description Methods addAction addBulkActions addBulkResourceObjects addResourceObject createObject deleteObject editObject getAccount getActions getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_User_Permission_Group record. getRoles getType Retrieve the type of the permission group. linkRole removeAction removeBulkActions removeBulkResourceObjects removeResourceObject unlinkRole

item.title: SoftLayer_User_Permission_Group_Type
item.description: SoftLayer_User_Permission_Group_Type Service Datatype Description Methods getGroups getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_User_Permission_Group_Type record.

item.title: SoftLayer_User_Permission_Role
item.description: SoftLayer_User_Permission_Role Service Datatype Description Methods addUser createObject deleteObject editObject getAccount getActions getGroups getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_User_Permission_Role record. getUsers linkGroup removeUser unlinkGroup

item.title: SoftLayer_User_Security_Question
item.description: SoftLayer_User_Security_Question Service Datatype Description Every user has an option of a secondary security login feature. This SoftLayer_User_Security_Question service provides a list of security questions. Methods getAllObjects Retrieve all viewable security questions. getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_User_Security_Question record.

item.title: SoftLayer_Utility_Network
item.description: SoftLayer_Utility_Network Service Datatype Description The SoftLayer_Utility_Network service allows users to send network diagnostic requests from SoftLayer’s application servers to a given host on the Internet. Methods nsLookup Perform a nameserver lookup on given address. whois Perform a WHOIS lookup on a given address.

item.title: SoftLayer_Virtual_DedicatedHost
item.description: SoftLayer_Virtual_DedicatedHost Service Datatype Description SoftLayer_Virtual_DedicatedHost models a single tenant virtual host dedicated to a specific account. Methods deleteObject Reclaim a dedicated host to cancel it's use. editObject Edit a dedicated host's properties. getAccount Retrieve the account that the dedicated host belongs to. getAllocationStatus Retrieve the container that represents allocations on the dedicated host. getAvailableRouters Get available backend routers in a datacenter to order a dedicated host.

item.title: SoftLayer_Virtual_Disk_Image
item.description: SoftLayer_Virtual_Disk_Image Service Datatype Description Methods editObject getAvailableBootModes getBillingItem Retrieve the billing item for a virtual disk image. getBlockDevices Retrieve the block devices that a disk image is attached to. Block devices connect computing instances to disk images. getBootableVolumeFlag getCoalescedDiskImages getCopyOnWriteFlag getIsEncrypted Retrieve return if image is encrypted getLocalDiskFlag getMetadataFlag Retrieve whether this disk image is meant for storage of custom user data supplied with a Cloud Computing Instance order.

item.title: SoftLayer_Virtual_Guest
item.description: SoftLayer_Virtual_Guest Service Datatype Description The virtual guest service provides a common interface to any virtualization platform supported by SoftLayer. The interaction with various third party APIs is not needed when implementing this service to administer your guests. The SoftLayer_Virtual_Guest service also controls individual CloudLayer Computing Instances purchased from SoftLayer in a way that is analogous to the [[SoftLayer_Hardware_Server]] service’s control over physical hardware purchased form SoftLayer. Methods activatePrivatePort Activate the private port activatePublicPort Activate the public port allowAccessToNetworkStorage Allow access to a SoftLayer_Network_Storage volume from this device.

item.title: SoftLayer_Virtual_Guest_Block_Device_Template_Group
item.description: SoftLayer_Virtual_Guest_Block_Device_Template_Group Service Datatype Description The virtual guest block device template group service provides a common interface to an accounts archived image templates The interaction with various third party APIs is not needed when implementing this service to administer your guests. Methods addByolAttribute addCloudInitAttribute addLocations [[SoftLayer_Virtual_Guest_Block_Devices|Block Devices]] can be made available in all storage locations. This method will create transaction(s) to add available locations to an archive image template.

item.title: SoftLayer_Virtual_Guest_Boot_Parameter
item.description: SoftLayer_Virtual_Guest_Boot_Parameter Service Datatype Description Methods createObject Create a boot parameter record to be used at next boot deleteObject Removes a boot parameter editObject Edits a single boot parameter getGuest getGuestBootParameterType getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Virtual_Guest_Boot_Parameter record.

item.title: SoftLayer_Virtual_Guest_Boot_Parameter_Type
item.description: SoftLayer_Virtual_Guest_Boot_Parameter_Type Service Datatype Description Methods getAllObjects getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Virtual_Guest_Boot_Parameter_Type record.

item.title: SoftLayer_Virtual_Guest_Network_Component
item.description: SoftLayer_Virtual_Guest_Network_Component Service Datatype Description The virtual guest network component service provides a common interface to a [[SoftLayer_Virtual_Guest|computing instance’s]] network component. Interaction with various third party APIs is not needed when implementing this service to administer your computing instances. Methods disable Disable a network component to restrict network traffic enable Enable a network component to allow network traffic getGuest Retrieve the computing instance that this network component exists on.

item.title: SoftLayer_Virtual_Host
item.description: SoftLayer_Virtual_Host Service Datatype Description The virtual host service provides a common interface to any virtualization platform supported by SoftLayer. Interaction with various third party APIs is not needed when implementing this service to administer your hosts. Methods getAccount Retrieve the account which a virtual host belongs to. getBilledPerGuestFlag Retrieve boolean flag indicating whether this virtualization platform gets billed per guest rather than at a fixed rate.

item.title: SoftLayer_Virtual_Storage_Repository
item.description: SoftLayer_Virtual_Storage_Repository Service Datatype Description Storage Repositories are storage systems that are accessible through the internet and can be accessed through many types of devices, interfaces, and other resources such as NFS (Network File System). They can contain 1 or more [[SoftLayer_Disk_Image|disk images]] and can be attached to more than one [[SoftLayer_Virtual_Host|host]]. Methods getAccount Retrieve the [[SoftLayer_Account|account]] that a storage repository belongs to. getArchiveDiskUsageRatePerGb The rate that is charged for archiving every 1 gigabyte of data for a computing instance getAverageUsageMetricDataByDate Returns the average disk usage for the timeframe based on the parameters provided.

item.title: SoftLayer_Service_External_Resource
item.description: SoftLayer_Service_External_Resource Datatype Description The SoftLayer_Service_External_Resource is a placeholder that references a service being provided outside of the standard SoftLayer system. Local accountId The customer account that is consuming the related service. Type: integer externalIdentifier The unique identifier in the service provider's system. Type: string id An external resource's unique identifier in the SoftLayer system. Type: integer
